page.title: 07ROADS OF FORFAR
page.content: {Main Roads}The Old Brechin Road is the one that carries on from Prior Road.It goes through Lunanhead,Aberlemno and on to Brechin. It is the A94 and is about 11 miles long.The Montrose Road is on the east side of Forfar.The route is B9113 and is approx.18 miles. The road passes through a wood and when it comes out the other side it becomes A934.The Kirriemuir Road is only 5 miles long, the A926.It passes through Maryton and Padanaram.The road from Forfar to Dundee is the A929.It is 14miles long.In the summer of 1985 they were making more of it dual carriageway.One of the main roads that lead out of Forfar is A932 to Friockheim which is 10 miles away.The road goes past there to Arbroath 5 miles further.The Carnoustie road is 14 miles long and passes through Kingsmuir, a mile and a half away.
